DKI Anggarkan Rp288 M untuk Normalisasi-Naturalisasi Sungai
05 Nov 2019, 23:41 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Kali Ciliwung Kampung Melayu saat ini termasuk kali yang menjadi tolak ukur untuk ketinggian debit air saat daerah sekitar Kelurahan Kampung Melayu akan terendam banjir kiriman dari Bogor dan sekitarnya. (CNN Indonesia/Andry Novelino)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta pada tahun ini kembali menganggarkan normalisasi sungai atau kali di ibu kota. Kepala Dinas Sumber Daya Air Juaini mengatakan normalisasi ini akan dilakukan pada kali yang lebarnya masih menyempit."Normalisasi kita anggarkan Rp288 miliar dan itu sudah disetujui DPRD," kata Juaini di DPRD DKI Jakarta, Selasa (5/11).Normalisasi merupakan kata yang sering dipakai pada era sebelum kepemimpinan Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan. Namun pada saat memimpin, Anies kerap mengungkapkan padanan kata naturalisasi.Juaini mengatakan kedua istilah itu tetap diterapkan pada tahun anggaran 2020. Naturalisasi dan normalisasi merupakan dua hal yang berbeda namun tetap dibutuhkan."Kalau normalisasi kan kali yang belum dibebaskan itu masih banyak lahan lahan warga kita normalisasi, kita dikembaliin lebarnya," ungkap dia."Kalau naturalisasi itu kita kembaliin ke alam lagi. Nanti di situ ada buat masyarakat. Anggarannya masuk ke dalam Rp288 itu," lanjut dia.Selain naturalisasi dan normalisasi, DKI juga menganggarkan dana sebesar Rp600 miliar untuk pengadaan lahan waduk serta sungai. Kemudian Juaini juga menganggarkan pengendalian banjir sebesar Rp400 miliar."Waduk yang itu sebenarnya sudah dibebasin, tinggal sisa-sisa pembebasan berapa bidang yang belum dibebasin. Ada sekitar 10 waduk penambahan. Kalau kali itu ada Kali Sunter, Pesanggrahan, dan Ciliwung," ungkap dia.Terakhir, secara keseluruhan total anggaran dari Dinas Sumber Daya Air yang sudah dibahas ialah sebesar Rp3,9 triliun. Ia berharap agar anggaran tersebut bisa menanggulangi banjir di Ibu Kota."Kalau penanggulangan banjir total keseluruhan SDA itu 3,9 triliun, itu termasuk lahan, pengendalian banjir, naturalisasi, di situ," tutup dia.Anggaran ini merupakan pembahasan anggaran tingkat komisi. Anggaran akan kembali dibahas di Badan Anggaran Besar dan akan masuk ke Kebijakan Umum APBD dan Plafon Prioritas Anggaran Sementara (KUAPPAS). (ctr/fea)

DKI allocates Rp. 288 billion for river normalization and naturalization
05 Nov 2019, 23:41 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ciliwung River Kampung Melayu is currently a time that serves as a benchmark for the height of water discharge when the area around Kampung Melayu Village will be submerged by floods from Bogor and its surroundings. (CNN Indonesia / Andry Novelino)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta this year has again budgeted river or river normalization in the capital. Head of the Juaini Water Resources Office said this normalization would be carried out at times where the width was still narrowing. "Normalization we budgeted Rp288 billion and it had been approved by the DPRD," Juaini said in the DKI Jakarta DPRD, Tuesday (11/5). used in the era before the leadership of DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan. But when leading, Anies often revealed the equivalent of the word naturalization. Juaini said the two terms were still applied in the 2020 fiscal year. Naturalization and normalization were two different things but were still needed. we normalize it, we will return the width, "he said." If we naturalize it, we will return to nature again. Later there will be for the community. The budget goes to Rp288, "he continued. In addition to naturalization and normalization, DKI also budgeted funds of Rp600 billion for the procurement of reservoirs and rivers. Then Juaini also budgeted flood control of Rp400 billion. "The reservoir has actually been cleared, leaving only the remaining number of fields that have not been cleared. There are about 10 additional reservoirs. If there were Sunter, Pesanggrahan and Ciliwung River," he said. Finally, the overall total budget from the Water Resources Agency that has been discussed is IDR 3.9 trillion. He hopes that the budget can cope with floods in the Capital City. "If the total flood mitigation is a total of 3.9 trillion natural resources, that includes land, flood control, naturalization, there," he concluded. This budget is a commission level budget discussion. The budget will be discussed again at the Large Budget Agency and will go into the APBD General Policy and the Provisional Budget Priority Ceiling (KUAPPAS). (ctr / fea)
